sub_topic: Calculation of the power output of an electrochemical cell
message_1: An electrochemical cell has a standard emf of 1.10 V and a current of 0.500 A when operating at standard conditions. What is the power output of the cell?
message_2:
The power output of an electrochemical cell can be calculated using the formula:

Power (P) = Voltage (V) × Current (I)

Given the standard emf (voltage) of 1.10 V and a current of 0.500 A, we can calculate the power output as follows:

P = 1.10 V × 0.500 A
P = 0.55 W (watts)

The power output of the electrochemical cell is 0.55 watts.
